metadata.feature_description: Provides drag-and-drop column resizing functionality in edit mode for visual layout adjustments.

steps.action: Navigate to Home page with ContentLayout module in edit mode
steps.actual: ContentLayout module with 2-column and 4-column layouts visible in edit mode

steps.action: Hover over the resize handle between columns
steps.expected: Size viewer appears showing current column percentages
steps.actual: Size viewer displayed showing 25% for each column in 4-column layout

steps.action: Drag the resize handle to resize columns
steps.expected: Column widths change during drag with visual feedback
steps.actual: Column widths changed from 25%/25%/25%/25% to approximately 33%/16%/25%/26% during drag
Column widths successfully changed and applied

steps.action: Drag resize handle to make one column as narrow as possible
steps.expected: Column cannot be resized below 105px minimum width
steps.actual: The dragged column respected 105px minimum, but adjacent column was resized to 86px (below minimum)

issues: Adjacent column can be resized below the 105px minimum width. The code in _onResize function sets next column width without minWidth check: ui.element.next().css('width', totalWidth - width) has no minimum enforcement for the adjacent column.

steps.action: Drag resize handle to make one column as wide as possible
steps.expected: Column cannot exceed calculated maximum width (leaving room for adjacent column)
steps.actual: Maximum width constraint is enforced - column stops resizing when adjacent column reaches minimum width

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify resize updates persist after save

steps.action: Resize columns to specific widths (61%/39% on 2-column layout)
steps.expected: Column sizes are saved via API call
steps.actual: UpdateLayoutWithColumnSizes API was called and sizes were saved

steps.action: Refresh the page to verify persistence
steps.expected: Column widths persist after page refresh
steps.actual: Column widths persisted after page refresh - 61%/39% layout maintained

steps.expected: 4 columns visible with resize handles between them
steps.actual: 4-column layout (CAMERAS, BLU-RAY PLAYERS, MONITORS, plus one more) visible with resize handles

steps.expected: Multiple columns can be resized independently
steps.actual: Columns can be resized with size viewer showing all column percentages

steps.expected: Size viewer overlay appears showing column widths as percentages
steps.actual: Size viewer with semi-transparent dark background appeared showing '25%' for each column

steps.expected: Size viewer updates in real-time during drag
steps.actual: Size viewer updated dynamically showing changing percentages (33%, 16%, 25%, 26%)

steps.expected: Size viewer fades out after resize completes
steps.actual: Size viewer faded out after mouse left the resize handle area

observations: The resize functionality uses jQuery UI Resizable plugin with 'e' (east) handle for horizontal resizing.
Minimum column width is set to 105px (colMinWidth in defaultOptions), but this constraint is only applied to the column being dragged, not the adjacent column.
Maximum width is dynamically calculated as: current column width + next column width - minimum width - 1.
Column sizes are persisted via the UpdateLayoutWithColumnSizes API endpoint which triggers the 'changeOnPageContent' event for the Publish/Discard workflow.
The size viewer shows column widths as percentages with a semi-transparent dark background overlay centered in each column.

A publish conflict error occurred during testing ('Another user has taken action on the page') because the resize operation immediately saves via API, changing the page state before the Publish button is clicked. This is expected behavior - the API auto-saves resize changes.
